description: Los Angeles Chargers linebacker Daiyan Henley is grappling with the tragic loss of his older brother, Jabari, who was fatally shot on October 31, 2025. The 34-year-old's death, believed to be linked to a personal dispute, has devastated the family. Despite immense grief, Daiyan chose to play, dedicating the game to his brother's memory.

title: Nigeria hits back at Trump: Prez Tinubu rejects claims of attacks on Christians
description: Nigeria has rejected claims of religious intolerance following a directive from former US President Donald Trump to prepare for potential military intervention over attacks on Christians. President Bola Ahmed Tinubu stated that the characterization does not reflect Nigeria's reality, emphasizing constitutional guarantees for freedom of belief for all citizens.

title: Can Curtis Sliwa upset the New York applecart?
description: Sliwa, 69, isn’t new to the rodeo. He founded the Guardian Angels in 1979 — a street-patrol crew born in the crime-ravaged Bronx — and spun it into a decades-long persona as a radio firebrand, neighbourhood vigilante, and walking emblem of New York grit. He stood for mayor in 2021 and lost heavily to Eric Adams, but never really left the trail. Now he’s back — still a Republican, still loud, still proudly fringe — and if the polls are right, still stuck in third place.

Shafali Verma's brilliant 87 guided India to 172 for three after 30 overs, setting up a historic chase for their maiden World Cup title against South Africa.

title: Holy aim? Shimla civic body ad shows Lord Rama’s arrow pointed at garbage; sparks outrage
description: Shimla police have filed a case following a complaint about a banner near the Himachal Pradesh Secretariat. The banner showed Lord Rama aiming an arrow at a garbage heap. An advocate alleged the display offended Hindu beliefs. Police are investigating the incident under relevant laws. The complaint also raised concerns about similar banners elsewhere in the city.

Ashwin's tweet minutes before the wicket about her potential hundred led to humorous fan accusations of a 'jinx'.

description: The University of Pennsylvania is probing a fake and offensive email that falsely appeared to come from its Graduate School of Education. The message, sent Friday with the subject “We got hacked,” contained racial slurs and attacked Penn’s integrity. The university confirmed the email was fraudulent, denied any hacking, and launched a cybersecurity investigation.

title: Corporate duty call: Seattle Mayor tells Amazon, Microsoft to reinvest; says they have obligation
description: Mayor Bruce Harrell urged Seattle's tech giants like Microsoft and Amazon to reinvest in the community, citing their substantial profits and a "moral obligation." This call highlights the city's challenge of balancing tech's economic benefits with its impacts on housing and transportation, as Harrell seeks re-election against a progressive challenger.

The burger utilizes indigenous technology developed by a Mysore-based institute, showcasing Indian innovation in traditional nutrition and global food trends.

description: Babar Azam's crucial half-century guided Pakistan to a series-clinching four-wicket victory over South Africa in the T20I decider. His composed 68 off 47 balls, supported by captain Salman Ali Agha's 33, helped Pakistan successfully chase 140. Pakistan's bowlers also played a key role, keeping South Africa under par.

description: The actor's mother, who was unwell for some time, left for her heavenly abode at the family's hometown in Belsand, Gopalganj, in Bihar on Friday, October 31.

Highest-ever! Mandhana shatters WC record; falls whisker short of another milestone
description: Smriti Mandhana has become India Women's highest run-getter in a single ODI World Cup edition, surpassing Mithali Raj's 2017 record. Mandhana narrowly missed reaching 1,000 World Cup runs, a feat achieved by only two other Indian batters.

description: ISRO successfully launched CMS-03, its heaviest communication satellite, using the LVM3-M5 rocket from Sriharikota. The mission marked the fifth operational flight for the LVM3 vehicle, placing the 4410-kg satellite into a Geo-synchronous Transfer Orbit. This multi-band satellite will provide crucial communication services over oceanic regions and the Indian landmass for both civil and strategic purposes.

title: Amitabh Bachchan was hesitant to do ‘Jumma Chumma’ hook step fearing it might look vulgar; Jaya Bachchan called it ‘superb’, recalls choreographer

description: India leveled the T20I series against Australia with a five-wicket victory in Hobart, successfully chasing 187. Washington Sundar's unbeaten 49 off 23 balls was pivotal, while Arshdeep Singh's early wickets earned him Player of the Match. Tim David's 74 had earlier propelled Australia to 186.

He claimed Modi panicked during a conflict with Pakistan due to Trump's intervention. Gandhi also criticized government policies like demonetization and GST for harming small businesses and pledged the INDIA bloc would prioritize Bihar's development and education.

Amid Asia Cup trophy controversy, Mohsin Naqvi's hug for emotional Babar Azam goes viral
description: Mohsin Naqvi, at the center of the Asia Cup controversy, was again in the spotlight congratulating Pakistan's T20I series win over South Africa. He met players, sharing a warm embrace with captain Babar Azam. This follows Pakistan's 2-1 series victory, with standout performances from Shaheen Afridi and Babar Azam leading the charge.

title: Watch: Delhi man opens door, indoor AQI jumps from 97 to 500 in seconds- viral video
description: Delhi's air quality has plunged to dangerous levels, with a viral post highlighting how opening a door instantly pushed indoor air quality from a 'poor' 100 AQI to a 'severe' 500, despite four purifiers running.  The city's overall AQI reached 386, with many areas reporting 'severe' pollution due to stagnant winds, making life unbearable for residents.

description: Josh Allen is set to play tonight against the Kansas City Chiefs. This game is significant for AFC playoff seeding. His performance is critical for a Bills victory in this high-stakes matchup.

description: Teacher absenteeism in Uttar Pradesh has emerged as a grave threat to the state’s education system, leaving rural classrooms deserted and students deprived of learning. The Allahabad High Court has strongly criticised the government for failing to implement an effective attendance mechanism, urging a “solid and practical” policy to ensure teachers’ presence and uphold poor children’s right to education.

Another Indian woman caught shoplifting in US; cries 'sorry' - video goes viral
description: A viral video shows an Indian woman crying and pleading with US officers, claiming she "forgot to pay" for items. The incident, which the TOI could not independently verify, echoes a previous case where an Indian tourist was arrested for shoplifting nearly $1,000 worth of goods. US authorities warn that such offenses can lead to visa revocation and future ineligibility.

description: Rain threatens to disrupt the ICC Women's World Cup final between India and South Africa in Navi Mumbai. The toss has been delayed, with a 25-50% chance of rain throughout the day. If play is interrupted, the match will resume on the reserve day, Monday, November 3, with provisions for reduced overs to ensure a fair result.

A frantic search is underway by police and forest officials, including drone deployment, as villagers express fear and demand action against the growing wolf threat.

2025 layoffs aren’t routine: AI rewires workflows; reskilling misses the point
description: The 2025 layoff wave reflects structural shifts, not mere cost-cutting. Companies, particularly in tech, are redirecting capital from headcount to AI infrastructure, automating tasks, and redesigning workflows. Pandemic-era hiring created surplus roles now being flattened. Reskilling alone won’t protect employees; differentiation comes from proving measurable impact. Students and professionals must focus on solving real problems, building domain-specific skill stacks, and demonstrating tangible improvements, as employers prioritise judgment and workflow integration over certificates or interchangeable skills.

Bhojpuri beats: Singers who rock the Bihar polls
description: Bhojpuri folk songs are a significant force in Bihar's election fervor, with both NDA and Mahagathbandhan leveraging catchy tunes to attract voters. Prominent singers and actors like Manoj Tiwari, Pawan Singh, Dinesh Lal Yadav, and Ravi Kishan are amplifying campaign messages, while Khesari Lal Yadav leads the Mahagathbandhan's musical outreach.

title: Mumbai's $800,000 shortcut: Wealthy Indians buying their way past H-1B hurdles
description: Facing decades-long waits for employment-based Green Cards, many Indians are opting for the EB-5 investment program. This route, requiring significant capital, offers a faster path to US residency, especially for H-1B visa holders and high-net-worth families securing their children's future. Despite recent discussions of a 'Gold Card' alternative, the EB-5 program, bolstered by recent reforms, continues to see strong demand.

title: Bihar polls: 20 yrs on, violence returns to Mokama as baahubalis clash for supremacy
description: A political murder in Bihar's Mokama has reignited fears of election violence after a local strongman, Dularchand Yadav, was killed during a poll campaign clash. His family blames JDU candidate Anant Singh, while Singh points fingers at rival Surajbhan Singh, whose wife is also contesting. The incident highlights deep-rooted caste rivalries and political complexities in the constituency.

title: Taylor Swift fears for her safety as Travis Kelce focuses on new season
description: Taylor Swift is reportedly concerned about her security and privacy, wanting to avoid excessive media attention during Kansas City Chiefs games. While not asking for broadcasts to stop, she desires to maintain a lower profile. Meanwhile, Travis Kelce praised Swift's latest album, "The Life of a Showgirl," on his podcast, highlighting its success.

title: Stefon Diggs’ alleged K’yanna Barber affair escalates as Cardi B expects baby
description: Rapper Cardi B is reportedly expecting twins with NFL player Stefon Diggs, but the couple faces controversy. Diggs is also accused of fathering twins with another woman, K’yanna Barber, a situation neither party has publicly addressed. This alleged infidelity has caused fan uproar as Cardi B continues to share her pregnancy publicly.

title: Musk, Rogan talk about alien object aiming at Earth that Harvard scientist say 'isn't natural'
description: Unauthorized SpaceX Starshield transmissions coincide with intense scrutiny of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar object exhibiting unusual nickel composition and trajectory. Discussions on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast with Elon Musk touched upon potential alien probes and the Tunguska Event, fueling speculation about extraterrestrial origins.

title: Sneako calls out Erika Kirk over viral JD Vance hug and Charlie Kirk remark
description: A viral video shows Erika Kirk, widow of Charlie Kirk, hugging Vice President JD Vance at a Turning Point USA event. Kirk's speech comparing Vance to her late husband sparked debate, with a subsequent hug drawing widespread online commentary. Streamer Sneako's mocking remarks added to the controversy, making the incident a major political talking point.

title: Shane Bieber’s wife reacts to Alejandro Kirk’s wife’s viral World Series post
description: Blue Jays catcher Alejandro Kirk's stellar World Series performance is matched by the heartwarming social media buzz surrounding his wife, Sofia Castaneda. A simple emoji comment from Shane Bieber's wife, Kara, on Sofia's post celebrating Kirk's success ignited a viral moment, highlighting the strong camaraderie among the team's families and captivating fans.

title: Vanessa Bryant recalls Kobe’s heartbreaking moment with daughter Gianna
description: Vanessa Bryant is releasing a photo book, 'Mamba & Mambacita Forever,' featuring cherished memories of Kobe and Gianna Bryant. She shared a touching moment from the 2009 NBA Finals, where Kobe cradled a young Gigi, his focus solely on his daughter's pride. The book aims to preserve these heartfelt moments for the world to remember.
